CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT- ASSISTANT
Professional Summary
Experienced professional with 10+ years experience in Project Management with a background in Real Estate, Residential, Commercial, Civil, Contract Management, project Coordination, Procurement, Business development and other facets of the Construction industry.
Demonstrated verifiable success leading multi-million dollar organizations through start-up, revitalization, and accelerated growth.
Solutions — driven , decisive and results-oriented with outstanding negotiation and crisis management skills.
Seeking an opportunity to leverage leadership, management, and business development skills to become a top-level construction manager.

Project Management Budget & Finances Personnel Acquisition & Training Team Management Customer Relations Site Management
New Business Development Value Engineering Procurement Oral and written communication Business writing

<JD_START>
Job Title: Construction Assistant

Location: Overland Park, KS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Project Management, Quality Assurance

Description:
Position Purpose/Summary

The Construction Coordinator is committed to providing the highest quality of service to the communities, customers, and employees we serve by organizing, tracking, and managing all types of telecommunications projects. High level duties involve allocating task, setting goals and deadlines, handling documentation and consulting with customers. This position is responsible for managing multiple major projects potentially involving all operational groups within the company.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities

Responsible for coordinating internal resources and third parties/vendors for the execution of projects.
Apply project management and conflict resolution processes to handle assigned projects.
Manage projects through to successful completion.
Prepare reports for a timely briefing on status of all projects for the Project Manager.
Identify and propose projects that will assist the business units in achieving their objectives.
Effectively utilize project management tools to track and report project status to management on a regular basis.
Produce reports; progress, scheduling, cost, scope, earned value, and other areas of the projects.
Assist in the documentation process of procedures utilized throughout the company.
Inspects and addresses QC checklists concerns to ensure installation of fiber/cable, conduit, pedestals, grounding, and protectors is compliant with company policy
Builds and maintains positive relationships with contractors, communicates regularly to enforce accountability to production expectations, KPI metric adherence, invoicing accuracy, receive and track change order requests, and proper material management and reconciliation
Liaise with Senior Leadership on project status including project status, budgetary compliance, and ensuring projects stay on track to meet company growth expectations
Performing all other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Knowledge, Abilities, & Skills for Success

Effectively communicate in a positive and professional manner through written and verbal communications in all interfaces with customers/public, fellow employees, and vendors.
Ability to use appropriate computer programs (including, but not limited to, Microsoft Office Suite) which includes having proficient computer skills and the ability to adapt and learn as programs and processes change.
Ability to work as a team member and exert initiative to work independently to reach a goal.
Ability to embrace change in the workplace while encouraging others to seek innovative approaches.
Ability to function effectively as a team player.
Knowledge of and the ability to comply with Company’s Customer Proprietary Network Information (CPNI) regulations and procedures.
Ability to work a flexible work schedule, as needed, to best serve our customers.
Qualifications
At a minimum, the Project Coordinator must have a bachelor’s degree in a related field along with 3+ years of project coordination experience or 5+ years of related experience and a valid driver’s license. Project Management Certifications are preferred but not required.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
